p: A COVID-19 vaccine does not necessarily have to contain/express SARS-CoV‑2 proteins. Since innate immune responses represent the first line of defence against invading pathogens, boosting these responses by applying live vaccines directed against, for example, tuberculosis, poliovirus or measles virus may reduce the susceptibility to SARS-CoV‑2 infections and the severity of COVID-19 [ 48].
